item.title: Explore the brain with Nilearn
item.description:
Description

In the past recent years, the Python programming language became popular and widely used in many science areas, that you can notes from huge amount of high quality scientific libraries available in GitHub. Python has already won the confidence in neuro-imaging community

Analysis of different neuroimaging modalities consists of identifying such a complex pipeline that include supporting specific MRI data acquisition, image processing, statistics and predictive modeling, and visualization of the results. Nilearn is a Python package designed to face these challenges. It provides state-of-the-art machine-learning methods for analysis task fMRI, resting-state, or anathomical data. In my talk, I would like to present general purpose of Nilearn, focusing on functional connectivity and connectome analysis in resting-state fMRI.

item.title: Introduction to Data-Analysis with Pandas / Time Series Analysis with Pandas
item.description:
Description

Pandas is the Swiss-Multipurpose Knife for Data Analysis in Python. With Pandas dealing with data-analysis is easy and simple but there are some things you need to get your head around first as Data-Frames and Data-Series.

The first part of talk with provide an introduction to Pandas for beginners, while the second part will focus on Time Series Analysis with Pandas.

part one (~40") Introduction to Pandas

  • reading and writing data across multiple formats (CSV, Excel, JSON, SQL, HTML,â€¦)
  • statistical data analysis and aggregation.
  • work with built-in data visualisation
  • inner-mechanics of Pandas: Data-Frames, Data-Series & Numpy.

part two (~20") Time Series Analysis

  • how to analyse periodical data with pandas
  • how to mangle, reshape and pivot
  • caveats when working with timed data
  • visualize your data on the fly

bonus (if we have time left)

  • gain insights with statsmodels (e.g. seasonality)
